title: Potential energy change after force acts

content.question: A particle that is constrained to move along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is acted upon by a conservative force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that varies according to the function <math alttext="F of x, equals the fraction negative k, over x cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a positive constant with units of <math alttext="newton meters cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the correct expression for the change in potential energy as the particle moves from <math alttext="x equals x sub 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="x equals x sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta U equals, 3 k times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1, over x sub 1, end sub, to the fourth power, end fraction, minus the fraction 1, over x sub 2, end sub, to the fourth power, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta U equals, one half k times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1, over x sub 1, end sub, squared, end fraction, minus the fraction 1, over x sub 2, end sub, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta U, equals 2 k times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1, over x sub 1, end sub, squared, end fraction, minus the fraction 1, over x sub 2, end sub, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta U, equals k times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1, over x sub 1, end sub, squared, end fraction, minus the fraction 1, over x sub 2, end sub, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta U, equals one fourth k times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1, over x sub 1, end sub, to the fourth power, end fraction, minus the fraction 1, over x sub 2, end sub, to the fourth power, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta U equals, one half k times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1, over x sub 1, end sub, squared, end fraction, minus the fraction 1, over x sub 2, end sub, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
